review: I use the Fire TV stick on the 2nd tv but I still prefer the Roku 3 device I use on my first TVs.  I just think the Roku 3 has a better remote and better TV app options, but for a 2nd TV it works well.
author: Timothy M. Hermann

review: The Fire TV Stick is the best small-footprint streaming media solution for anyone who does not have a smartphone.  It is extremely quick and easy to set up and you are ready to go in minutes.  Now let's look at some facts here...Pros:- Quick and easy setup- Easy navigation- Fire TV Remote Control App provides excellent- Excellent suite of streaming apps (Netflix, HBO Go, Showtime Anytime, Plex)- Sideloading for the adventurousCons:- Apps are slow to install/load the first time (after that they are plenty fast)- Fire TV Remote Control App functionality only extends to the main menu and Amazon-specific sub-menus. Netflix, for example, cannot be voice searched.- Remote is very small and easy to lose- Battery compartment is tough to get open (you feel like you're about to break it)- Initial setup puts games in your face but they require separate controller.
author: Mass Daddy
